name: Hepatitis E
description: A liver disease caused by the hepatitis E virus, commonly transmitted through contaminated water.

name: Hepatitis D
description: A liver infection that occurs only in people infected with hepatitis B virus.

name: Norovirus Infection
description: A contagious virus causing vomiting and diarrhea, often linked to contaminated food or water.

name: Hand, Foot and Mouth Disease
description: A common viral illness affecting children with sores in the mouth and rash on hands and feet.

name: Tularaemia
description: A rare infectious disease spread by animals and insects, causing fever and skin ulcers.

name: Q Fever
description: A bacterial infection caused by Coxiella burnetii, often spread from animals to humans.

name: Nipah Virus Infection
description: A zoonotic virus causing respiratory issues and brain inflammation with a high fatality rate.

name: Crimean-Congo Hemorrhagic Fever
description: A tick-borne viral disease causing severe hemorrhagic symptoms.

name: Actinomycosis
description: A rare bacterial infection that causes abscesses in the mouth, lungs, or digestive organs.

name: Leptospirosis
description: A bacterial disease spread through the urine of infected animals, especially in flood-prone areas.

name: Strongyloidiasis
description: A parasitic infection caused by roundworms found in contaminated soil.

name: Onchocerciasis
description: Also known as river blindness, caused by a parasitic worm transmitted by blackflies.

name: Trichuriasis
description: An intestinal infection caused by the whipworm, common in tropical areas.

name: Entamoeba Histolytica Infection
description: A parasitic infection of the intestines, causing diarrhea and liver abscesses.

name: Amebiasis
description: A protozoan infection causing diarrhea and colitis, spread through contaminated food or water.

name: Cholangitis
description: Inflammation of the bile duct system, usually caused by a bacterial infection.

name: Oral Candidiasis
description: A fungal infection in the mouth caused by Candida species, also known as oral thrush.

name: Tinea Versicolor
description: A fungal skin condition that causes discolored patches on the skin.

name: Coccidioidomycosis
description: A fungal infection also known as Valley fever, rare in India but imported via travel.

name: Mycetoma
description: A chronic granulomatous infection of the skin and subcutaneous tissues caused by fungi or bacteria.

name: Laryngitis
description: Inflammation of the voice box due to infection, overuse, or irritation.

name: Otitis Media
description: A middle ear infection causing ear pain and hearing issues, common in children.

name: Sinusitis
description: Inflammation or infection of the sinus cavities, causing facial pain and congestion.

name: Barrett’s Esophagus
description: A condition where the esophageal lining changes, sometimes leading to esophageal cancer.

name: Esophageal Varices
description: Swollen veins in the esophagus, usually due to liver disease, which can rupture and bleed.

name: Hemophilia
description: A genetic bleeding disorder where blood doesn’t clot properly due to missing clotting factors.

name: Idiopathic Thrombocytopenic Purpura (ITP)
description: An autoimmune condition leading to low platelet counts and bleeding.

name: Thrombophilia
description: A condition where the blood has an increased tendency to clot.

name: Paget’s Disease of Bone
description: A chronic bone disorder causing bones to become enlarged and deformed.

name: Hyperparathyroidism
description: Excessive secretion of parathyroid hormone leading to high calcium levels and bone issues.

name: Cushing’s Syndrome
description: A hormonal disorder caused by high levels of cortisol in the body.

name: Addison’s Disease
description: A rare disorder where adrenal glands don’t produce enough hormones.

name: Acromegaly
description: A hormonal disorder where excess growth hormone causes abnormal growth of bones and tissues.

name: Hirschsprung’s Disease
description: A congenital condition causing bowel obstruction due to missing nerve cells in the colon.

name: Wilson’s Disease
description: A rare genetic disorder causing copper buildup in organs, especially the liver and brain.

name: Turner Syndrome
description: A genetic disorder affecting females, characterized by short stature and ovarian dysfunction.

name: Klinefelter Syndrome
description: A genetic condition in males caused by an extra X chromosome, affecting development.

name: Tourette Syndrome
description: A neurological disorder characterized by repetitive involuntary movements and vocalizations.

name: Marfan Syndrome
description: A genetic disorder affecting connective tissue, often involving the heart, eyes, and skeleton.

name: Ehlers-Danlos Syndrome
description: A group of genetic disorders affecting connective tissues, causing hyperflexibility and fragile skin.

name: Systemic Sclerosis
description: An autoimmune disease causing hardening and tightening of the skin and connective tissues.

name: Sjogren’s Syndrome
description: An autoimmune disorder affecting moisture-producing glands, causing dry eyes and mouth.

name: Interstitial Lung Disease
description: A group of disorders causing progressive scarring of lung tissue, affecting breathing.

name: Bronchiectasis
description: A chronic condition where the walls of the bronchi are thickened due to inflammation and infection.

name: Sarcoidosis
description: An inflammatory disease that affects multiple organs, mostly the lungs and lymph glands.

name: Restless Legs Syndrome
description: A neurological condition causing an uncontrollable urge to move the legs.

name: Trigeminal Neuralgia
description: A chronic pain condition affecting the trigeminal nerve in the face.

name: Tension Headache
description: A common type of headache caused by muscle tension, stress, or anxiety.

name: Obstructive Sleep Apnea
description: A sleep disorder where breathing repeatedly stops and starts due to throat muscle relaxation.

name: Insomnia
description: A sleep disorder characterized by difficulty falling or staying asleep.

name: Epiglottitis
description: A life-threatening condition where the epiglottis becomes inflamed and can block airflow.

name: Guillain-Barre Syndrome
description: A rare neurological disorder where the body’s immune system attacks peripheral nerves.

name: Idiopathic Pulmonary Fibrosis
description: A chronic lung disease causing progressive scarring of lung tissue.

name: Nephrotic Syndrome
description: A kidney disorder causing excessive protein loss in urine and swelling in the body.

name: Acute Glomerulonephritis
description: An inflammatory kidney condition often following streptococcal infections.

name: Hydronephrosis
description: Swelling of the kidneys due to urine buildup, often from obstruction or reflux.

name: Renal Calculi
description: Also known as kidney stones, they are hard deposits formed in the kidneys.

name: Urethritis
description: Inflammation of the urethra, often due to infection.

name: Prostatitis
description: Inflammation of the prostate gland, often causing painful urination and pelvic discomfort.

name: Polycystic Ovary Syndrome (PCOS)
description: A hormonal disorder causing enlarged ovaries with small cysts on the outer edges.

name: Endometriosis
description: A condition where tissue similar to the lining inside the uterus grows outside the uterus.

name: Pelvic Inflammatory Disease
description: An infection of the female reproductive organs, often caused by sexually transmitted bacteria.

name: Testicular Torsion
description: A painful condition where the spermatic cord twists, cutting off blood flow to the testicle.

name: Menopause
description: The natural biological process marking the end of a woman’s menstrual cycles, typically around age 50.

name: Osteomalacia
description: Softening of the bones due to a vitamin D deficiency, leading to bone pain and weakness.

name: Paget’s Disease of Bone
description: A chronic bone disorder causing bones to become enlarged and deformed.
